bullets.text: Powell says DOJ criminal probe risks Fed independence and signals political intimidation; raises uncertainty around monetary policy credibility and governance.
Reports say federal prosecutors opened an inquiry into Fed Chair Powell, intensifying institutional conflict between White House/DOJ and the central bank.
Markets sold off on Powell probe headlines, highlighting sensitivity of risk assets to perceived Fed politicization and policy path uncertainty.
Investor narrative is building around a 2026 commodities “supercycle,” implying sustained demand-driven price strength and renewed inflation pressure via inputs.
Allegiant agreed to buy Sun Country for ~$1.5B, consolidating U.S. low-cost carriers and potentially reshaping capacity discipline, pricing, and routes.
Trump moves against Venezuela: seeks to control U.S.-based oil revenues and cut Venezuela’s support to Cuba, escalating sanctions and regional energy leverage.
Mexico faces pressure after U.S. cartel threats and Venezuela strike; response could affect trade, security cooperation, and cross-border investment risk premia.
Iran’s protest crackdown and rising deaths increase odds of instability; U.S. reports indicate Trump weighing options, raising regional escalation and oil-risk tails.
Arctic competition is intensifying; interest in Greenland and Svalbard underscores strategic value of routes, minerals, and basing as great-power rivalry expands north.
Google and Walmart expand AI-driven shopping and launch protocols for “commerce agents,” accelerating platform competition over discovery, checkout, and retail data.
Boeing deliveries hit a 7-year high with plans to ramp production, signaling improving aerospace supply chains and potential revenue/margin recovery if quality holds.
Science advances: new gravity theory for cosmic acceleration; injection reprograms tumor immune cells; optics-breaking imaging tech suggests new sensing/medical capabilities.
